job_description:
Amsterdam, Netherlands | Engineering | Full-time
Not your everyday company
Lemonade completely reinvented how insurance works. As a customer-centric tech company, we created an insurance experience that is smart, instant, and delightful.
At Lemonade, you’ll be working with a group of like-minded makers, who get a kick out of moving fast and delivering great products. We surround ourselves with some of the smartest, most motivated, creative people who are filled with positive energy and good karma.
Unlike most publicly traded companies, we’re nimble and efficient. We take pride in the fact that we still think and operate like a startup. We don’t care much about titles and hierarchy and instead focus on innovation, bold moves, and challenging the status quo.
We’re built as a lean, data-driven organization that relies on a common understating of objectives and goals to provide teams with autonomy and ownership. We don’t like spending our days in meetings and we skip committees altogether. At Lemonade, there’s no such thing as going over someone’s head. We have zero tolerance for bureaucracy, office politics, and lean-back personalities.
As a Public Benefit Corporation and a certified B-Corp, we deliver environmental and social impact using our products and tech. Through our Giveback program, we partner with organizations such as the ACLU, New Story, The Humane Society, Malala Fund, American Red Cross, 360.org, charity: water, and dozens of others, and have donated millions towards reforestation, education, animal rights, LGBTQ+ causes, access to water, and more.
Awarded ‘best workplace’
Best Workplace and Best-Led Company by Inc. Magazine
“World Changing” by Fast Company
Recognized as a World Changing Idea by Fast Company Magazine
Ranked #1 Home insurance in America
Won best renters and homeowners insurance in America by US News, and others
Best Pet Insurance in America
Rated “Best Overall Pet Insurance” by Better Homes & Gardens
Rated 4.9 on the App Store
Among the highest rated apps of all time
What you’re applying for
We’re looking for an experienced QA Engineer who is passionate about technology and inspired by great UX.

You’ll be instrumental in bringing features to the finish line while collaborating closely with developers, as well as with the Product and Data, and Machine Learning teams—all with the goal of delivering a seamless, joyful experience for our customers.

In this role you’ll
Analyse user stories to identify test cases, ensuring an appropriate mix of manual and automated test coverage
Use data to assess the quality and identify improvement tasks that should be prioritized
Provide an assessment of delivery readiness and collaborate with other teams to ensure timely release
Help maintain our outstanding customer experience by having a diligent eye for UI details
What you’ll need
3+ years experience as a QA engineer
Hands-on experience running manual tests on multiple platforms for user-facing products
Ability to create beautifully written test plans, define testing strategies, and document knowledge
Superior analytical skills with a problem-solving attitude
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English
Experience with UI or API automation tools (Cypress, Postman, Loadmill, etc.) is a major advantage
Things to know…
Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you require reasonable accommodations due to religious beliefs, pregnancy, or disabilities, let us know at any time.

Best Workplace and Best-Led Company by Inc. Magazine
“World Changing” by Fast Company
Recognized as a World Changing Idea by Fast Company Magazine
Ranked #1 Home insurance in America
Won best renters and homeowners insurance in America by US News, and others
Best Pet Insurance in America
Rated “Best Overall Pet Insurance” by Better Homes & Gardens
Rated 4.9 on the App Store
Among the highest rated apps of all time
What you’re applying for
We’re looking for a talented candidate who understands personal lines property, casualty coverage, and risk, and can manage the execution and oversight of an underwriting strategy. If you’re analytically minded, hands-on, and an aggressive self-starter, this one’s for you!

In this role, you’ll be a central member of our Insurance team in Europe, supporting the Customer Experience, Claims, and Product teams as required. We’ll look to you to own and enhance our European underwriting strategy and bring forward measures to improve the quality and performance of our book.

You’ll own several areas of responsibility: evaluating new and existing products; drafting policy wording in cooperation with the insurance product team; and executing the underwriting strategy—using limited data, and a lot of creativity.


What you’ll need
5 + years of underwriting experience in personal lines property, liability, or car insurance
Deep knowledge of policy forms, guidelines, and compliance-related matters
Track record of managing a profitable, growing book of business
Experience working collaboratively
Data-driven and tech savvy, with plenty of independence, drive, and optimism
You’re an all-around team player who learns fast, is eager to solve problems, and loves getting shit done!


About Lemonade

Lemonade is a licensed insurance carrier offering renters, homeowners, life, and pet insurance in the United States, contents and liability insurance in Germany and the Netherlands, and renters insurance in France. We’re powered by artificial intelligence and behavioral economics, and driven by social good.


A Certified B-Corp, Lemonade donates unused premiums to nonprofits selected by its community as part of our annual Giveback program. We incorporate our values into everything we do—from our business model to our office culture.
Things to know…
Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you require reasonable accommodations due to religious beliefs, pregnancy, or disabilities, let us know at any time.

What you’re applying for
We're looking for a highly motivated Engineering manager who will lead the technological strategy, build the tech agenda, work closely with the technical stakeholders, and drive their squad to be accountable owners of their work as they meet company business goals.

What you'll do
Oversee and own the professional and personal development of your team as you help them elevate their skills
Lead the technological strategy and build the tech agenda
Run your squad’s bi-weekly sprint and manage quarterly planning
Drive your squad to be accountable owners of their work as they meet company business goals
Collaborate closely with the Product team as you strive to achieve your squad’s OKRs
What you'll need
3 + years working as an engineering manager/team lead
5+ years working as a backend developer
BSc Computer Science, Mathematics, or related degree
All-around team player who is self-motivated and inventive
Passion for code craftsmanship
Experience working on high-scale, production-grade projects
Experience in building and managing large-scale backend infrastructure systems
Experience with modern backend technologies, such as cloud computing, microservice architecture, containerisation and distributed systems
A history of contributing to open-source projects is a plus
Things to know…

What you’re applying for
Recruiting Operations Lead

We’re looking for a self-motivated Recruiting Operations Lead to support our global Talent Acquisition team. You’ll manage all operational aspects of recruitment around the world, which will require not only strong expertise in this field but also resourcefulness, creativity, and strategic thinking.

As the leader of talent acquisition operations you’ll develop a strategy that delivers an exceptional experience to both candidates and internal stakeholders, while supporting the global team. You will drive recruitment-process optimization by overseeing all recruitment systems and tools and their integration. With additional responsibility to project manage the team across non systems recruiting initiatives.

In this role you’ll
Work collaboratively within the Talent Acquisition team to develop best practice process and standards to ensure a high-quality candidate experience
Work closely with different stakeholders on forecasting, process, and compliance, enhancements to all Recruiting related systems.
Build out a strong data and analytics driven infrastructure
Forecast data and analytics related to recruiting and hiring for different departments and roles, and provide data and reports to recruiters and leadership
Evaluate potential new tools and technologies
Create and utilise survey details to continually improve both candidate and internal customer experience
Measures and monitor sourcing and recruiting activities for overall effectiveness and diversity-specific results
What you’ll need
8+ years experience in Talent Acquisition Operations or a related field
Project management experience and/or a Project Management Accreditation
Proficiency in recruiting management and HR software, preferably GreenHouse and Workday
Proficiency in recruiting analytics tool, preferably Looker
Comfortable managing multiple projects, large and small, with many stakeholders involved
Demonstrated experience designing and transforming processes and programs that align with company values
Outstanding leadership skills and ability to work as a key part of a global team
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Things to know…
Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you require reasonable accommodations due to religious beliefs, pregnancy, or disabilities, let us know at any time.

What you’re applying for
We're looking for a highly motivated, detail-oriented Corporate Governance Specialist with a passion for regulatory compliance, and risk management. You'll be part of the Corporate Governance team supporting our European governance cycle—focused on risk and regulatory compliance, and review and negotiation of commercial agreements.

In this role you’ll
Take part in planning, execution, and follow-up of company board meetings, contributing to how we shape, build, and scale our European operations
Work closely with senior managers across the Lemonade Group
Design and implement governance policies, processes, and procedures
Support Lemonade's Compliance and Risk management function holder through monitoring, assessing, and reporting
Support Regulatory Compliance through management of regulatory expectations, reporting and monitoring legislative changes
Review and negotiate commercial agreements, conducting legal research and performing due diligence assessments
What you'll need
Lawyer (LL.M) with 3-5 years experience practicing in relevant areas such as corporate governance, regulation, risk and compliance, commercial agreements, or privacy
Experience working in a similar role within a Solvency II-regulated entity (preferably in the insurance sector)
Comfortable working with senior management and board members
General experience with regulatory reporting, preparing presentations, and executive-level analysis and reviews
Adept at independently managing projects
A keen eye for detail, along with strong organizational, planning, and problem-solving skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Dutch
Things to know…
Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you require reasonable accommodations due to religious beliefs, pregnancy, or disabilities, let us know at any time.

What you’re applying for
We're looking for an experienced Audit Manager who will be responsible for leading and managing the audit program and driving the development of a next-generation, global audit function.

Reporting to the Audit and Risk Committee and to the Global Head of Internal Audit, you’ll develop a deep understanding of Lemonade risk, controls, technology, and processes that will help you define an agile audit program, delivering value-add audits and high-quality audit reports.

What you’ll do
Support Lemonade’s internal audit plan through the execution of related audits from beginning to end
Lead audits, demonstrating a solid working knowledge of audit standards and frameworks (for example, COSO) that impact the organization both in the EU and globally
Develop audit reports on the effectiveness of the internal control structure for an executive-level audience, ensuring reported findings are appropriately documented and supported by evidence
Develop customized and valuable solutions to issues identified during the course of audits
Assist in the preparation of internal audit materials for the Audit and Risk Committee and Board of Directors
Assist with responses to regulatory inquiries as they relate to internal audit matters
What you’ll need
6+ years of experience in an internal audit, public accounting, or consulting role
Relevant certifications (CPA, CIA, CISA, CISSP, CFE)
Familiarity with relevant frameworks (e.g., COSO, COBIT, NIST)
Technical acumen and/or experience in insurance or other key business operations
Strong track record of delivering on audits and/or process improvement projects
Highly analytical, with a passion for redefining the way internal audits are executed
Experience with a fintech company or financial services company (preferably with an understanding/exposure to insurtech)
Things to know…
Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you require reasonable accommodations due to religious beliefs, pregnancy, or disabilities, let us know at any time.

What you’re applying for
We’re on the search for an empathetic, communicative individual to join our claims experience team. If you have a background in customer experience and a genuine passion for helping others, you’re going to love this opportunity.

In this role, you’ll work closely with Lemonade’s Claims Experience Adjusters to settle property loses and defy customer expectations along the way. With a customer-first mindset, you’ll be responsible for handling simple or fast-track claims. For more info about the role, check out our latest Transparency Chronicle.

What you’ll do
Providing surprisingly delightful experiences to our customers through all our channels (email, phone, etc.)
Investigate and handle claims from start to finish
Organize and prioritize daily tasks in order to resolve claim-based questions
Working with management to help shaping processes
What you’ll need
Minimum of 2+ years of claims-handling experience
Proficient in French and English
Desire to work in a unique, dynamic, and fast-paced startup environment
Efficient and loves to get shit done
The ability to approach your work with empathy, patience, and positivity
Things to know…
Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you require reasonable accommodations due to religious beliefs, pregnancy, or disabilities, let us know at any time.

What you’re applying for
We’re looking for a senior-level backend engineer to join our growing Engineering team in Amsterdam.

This role will require you to bring features to the finish line while collaborating closely with other developers, as well as with the Product, QA, Data, and Machine Learning teams—all with the goal of delivering a seamless, joyful experience for our customers.

In this role you’ll
Help build our products using microservices written in Typescript (using NestJS) and Ruby on Rails running over Kubernetes
Leverage our in-house autonomous tools to manage all development flow, from setting up our development environment to creating git branches and deploying services to production
Collaborate closely with the Product team, in a self-sufficient squad to achieve the squad’s OKRs
Be the owner of your domain to ensure code quality, performance, and scalability of our products
Coach and mentor other developers and help them elevate their skills
What you’ll need
5+ years working as a backend engineer
BSc in Computer Science or Mathematics (or equivalent experience)
Passionate about technology
Broad knowledge of modern backend frameworks, tools, and architecture
Experience working on high scale, production-grade projects
Past contributions to open source projects are a plus
Ability to work in an office environment
Experience in the payments domain
Things to know…
Lemonade is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusivity. We never discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. We don’t like spending our days in meetings and we skip committees altogether. At Lemonade, there’s no such thing as going over someone’s head. We have zero tolerance for bureaucracy, office politics, and lean-back personalities.
As a Public Benefit Corporation and a certified B-Corp, we deliver environmental and social impact using our products and tech. Through our Giveback program, we partner with organizations such as the ACLU, New Story, The Humane Society, Malala Fund, American Red Cross, 360.org, charity: water, and dozens of others, and have donated millions towards reforestation, education, animal rights, LGBTQ+ causes, access to water, and more.

What you’re applying for
We’re looking for an engineering manager to oversee a backend engineering squad. Are you a people-oriented leader with strong soft skills who is capable of managing complex projects? Do you want to build incredible software at record speeds? Do you think creatively, and are you great at execution? If so, you’ve come to the right place.

In this role, you’ll be responsible for the professional and personal development of your team. You’ll lead the technological strategy, build the tech agenda, work closely with the Product team, and drive your squad to be accountable owners of their work as they meet company business goals.

In this role you’ll
Oversee and own the professional and personal development of your team as you help them elevate their skills
Lead the technological strategy and build the tech agenda
Run your squad’s bi-weekly sprint and manage quarterly planning
Drive your squad to be accountable owners of their work as they meet company business goals
Collaborate closely with the Product team as you strive to achieve your squad’s OKRs
What you’ll need
3 + years working as an engineering manager/team lead
5+ years working as a backend developer
BSc Computer Science, Mathematics, or related degree
All-around team player who is self-motivated and inventive
Passion for code craftsmanship
Experience working on high-scale, production-grade projects
Experience in the payments or the authentication domain
A history of contributing to open-source projects is a plus
